tagline: Oklahoma's weather lottery with a $100K prize purse and a guaranteed Bobby hug.
race_date: 2026: March 13-14 (Pro race Friday, Amateur race Saturday)

course.terrain_surface: Oklahoma red clay—fast when dry, adhesive mud when wet
course.signature_challenge: The weather lottery. You train for months but Oklahoma decides what race you're riding.
course.character: Fast and tactical when dry. Unrideable mud slog when wet. The weather decides what race you're getting.
key_features: Surface quality depends entirely on weather

suffering_zones.label: First Reality Check
suffering_zones.desc: Aid station one. Decide if you're racing or surviving.

suffering_zones.label: The Grind Begins
suffering_zones.desc: Aid station two. 40 miles left. Mental game starts here.

suffering_zones.label: The Final Push
suffering_zones.desc: Last 15 miles. You can see the finish but your legs disagree.

course.climate_description: Early March brings 40-75°F swings, potential freezing rain, potential heat, potential wildfires
climate_challenges: Weather unpredictability is THE defining feature
Red clay turns to peanut butter mud when wet

biased_opinion.summary: The Mid South is what happens when someone builds a gravel race around unreasonable hospitality instead of unreasonable suffering. Bobby Wintle hugs every finisher. The DFL gets the biggest trophy. The community shows up like their lives depend on it. And the weather? The weather does whatever Oklahoma wants. When it's dry, you get a blazing-fast tactical race. When it's wet, you get an unrideable mud nightmare. Either way, you finish to live music, local beer, and a town that genuinely wants you there. This isn't the hardest gravel race. It's not the longest. But it might be the one with the biggest heart.

logistics.date_specific: 2026: March 13-14 (Pro race Friday, Amateur race Saturday)
logistics.parking: Free parking available downtown. Easier than Unbound logistics.
logistics.registration: Lottery system ('The Randomizer'). Opens October. Cost: ~$165 (100mi)
logistics.start_time:
Pro Race: Friday 1:00 PM (2026 new format)
Amateur Race: Saturday 6:00 AM

training_plans.race_challenge_tagline: unpredictable weather and potential red dirt chaos

prize_purse: $100,000 (split equally between elite men and women)
